entities: International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Tribunals
summary:
The Security Council,

Adopted resolution 1995 (2011) on 6 July 2011, 

Recalling previous resolutions on the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda (ICTR), 

Requests the ICTR to expedite its work, 

Decides as follows:

1. Ad litem judges can be elected as President and vote in the election.

2. An ad litem judge elected as President has same powers as a permanent judge, without additional benefits.

3. An ad litem judge elected as Vice-President can act as President, without additional benefits.

4. Judge Dennis Byron can work part-time from 1 September 2011 until case completion.

5. All States are urged to cooperate with the ICTR, particularly to bring indictees to justice.

6. The ICTR needs adequate staffing; UN bodies are called to cooperate.

7. States are commended for accepting relocation of acquitted or convicted persons.

8. The Security Council remains seized of the matter.
